Detailed Description

A MergeProvider merges the columns of two providers by the specified column id for the specified merge rule. The result contains all rows of the source provider, joined with the first matching row of the merge provider. If no row matshes, c_merged_row_id will return c_no_row.
This provider offers the folling additional columns:
c_merged_row_id NumberType The joined key row. Must be used for append and insert.
c_merged_provider_id ProviderType The merged provider (may be 0).

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum MergeProvider::AffectedProvider
 

Which provider should be affected by modifing operations.

Enumerator:
Both  both providers, this is default
ChildOnly  only the first
MergeOnly  only the second
None  Read only.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

MergeProvider::MergeProvider (   ) 
 

If the default constructor is used, the parameters have to be provided by using the method Init.

MergeProvider::MergeProvider (  INT  provider_id,
Provider *  child_provider,
Provider *  merge_provider,
INT  child_key_colid,
INT  merge_key_colid,
JoinRule *  merge_rule,
UINT  max_cache_depth = 6
) 
 

On construction the following parameters have to be specified:

  • provider_id: The provider id for this MergeProvider.
  • child_provider: The provider which should be appended.
  • merge_provider: The provider which is merged into src_provider.
  • child_colid: The column id of the source provider which should be used as join key.
  • merge_colid: The column id of the merge provider which should be used as join key.
  • merge_rule: The first child provider which should be joined.
  • max_cache_depth: The maximum recursive depth of temporary cached rows during a complete update. Please be aware, that the given cache depth results in (2^n-1) cache entries, the default cache depth is 6, so per default a maximum of 63 DataItems are cached. The memory of this cache is allocated during Update() and freed afterwards automatically.

MergeProvider::~MergeProvider (   )  [virtual]
 

Destructor.
